messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] knowing the Laws was knowing what is going on i
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/19/02 8:37:15 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... This is something I hear alot, from people in many states! (My area is, my district is) Now
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/19/02 8:37:15 AM Eastern Standard Time,
scribblers2@... writes:

> I agree.. it also depends on which county you live in .. some really
> hassle homeschoolers and try to go way beyond the regs.
>
> peace,
> Susan
>
>
This is something I hear alot, from people in many states! (My area is, my
district is)
Now granted, in some states the law is written so that local districts get
"leeway" but a state law is a state law. If one's county is "bad" and
umbrella school is not an option, one must be particularly vigilant about the
requirements.
Don't do mare than the law requires. Unless you want the law to change and
the recommendations to become requirements! (as some groups we know DO)
Elissa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
